metadata.title: CVE-2018-12386 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: A vulnerability in register allocation in JavaScript can lead to type confusion, allowing for an arbitrary read and write. This leads to remote code execution inside the sandboxed content process when triggered. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.2.2 and Firefox < 62.0.3.

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '62.0.3+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
